page.title: 02FARMING IN MONYASH
page.content:
{Monyash House Farm}is 250 years old and Mr C.Robinson has lived there for 30 years.He owns a{dairy farm}and a small{beef herd. The farm has 280 acres of land (103 hectares).The farm employs between 4 and 8 self-employed labourers depending upon the time of year.The busiest time is silaging time.160 acres are used for silage.Cows graze the rest. There are 80 dairy cows and 120 young ones.About 300 gallons (1,360 litres) of milk are produced each day.The calves are de_horned with a hacksaw when they are two weeks old.
Out of 26 farms in the area,about 58% are{small farms}with a mixture of animals _ usually cows and sheep and sometimes pigs.
